p.s: The extract of the Texttext Is the usefulness of unions coming to an end? The answer is yes written by Brian Pollard and published in The Gulf News on 24 November, 2011 is about the usefulness of unions and how the goals of the unions have changed over the last years.

The Texttext starts with the first opinion of the author, that unions were the best thing that happendhappened to the labour movement because of the bad working conditions including higher wages, being mistreatetmistreated by employers and having long work days.
But the goals of the unions changed over the last years in the twenty-first century.

Unions were made to help the employees to have a secured working place, but today the unions are about power and greed, they even obstruct companies' abilities to compete because the services that unions produce are so expensive, that they can't compete against cheaper and non-unions producer any longer.

The fact that their job is protected by their union makes the members work less productive because they have nothing to looselose and thethey have become more powerful than their employers what leads to an unhealthy business environment.

In the end is the decision of the author, that the government has to take a hard look at the situation with unions and has to discover that unions are not helpfullhelpful anymore and can lead to a worse working place than it was before.
